description:
Why would famous Hollywood actor Robert Redford bring documentaries into a major film Festival? 

Why does a website dedicated to screening documentary films get more than 1 million hits a month?

Documentary films are a powerful narrative art form and one of the most challenging forms of filmmaking to master. 

They are also one of the most powerful storytelling genres available to anyone, since they enable conveying complex and important ideas in a structured fashion with emotional engagement.

By learning documentary filmmaking with veteran documentary film director Paul Jenkins, you will dramatically improve not only your orientation and ability to make outstanding documentary films to convey your message and progress your interests, you will also gain a deeper understanding of filmmaking and storytelling which will benefit you significantly in many areas of activity-not just the arts.

Once you gain entry to this course, you will be able to discuss documentary filmmaking with the Paul, including being able to directly asked questions via the discussions area of this course. 

Students are putting forward their documentary ideas and plans in the course Discussions, and getting professional feedback on the best strategies and approaches to take.

Enrol in the course now, and get started with powerful and engaging storytelling.
title: Documentary Making: Powerful On Screen Storytelling
